title: Slipstream Think-Quantize-Transmit Dataset
description:
Training dataset for the Slipstream protocol - a semantic quantization system achieving 82% token reduction in multi-agent AI communication. Contains 2,283 examples teaching the Think-Quantize-Transmit (TQT) cognitive pattern: reasoning about intent, mapping to semantic anchors in a 4D manifold (ACTION, POLARITY, DOMAIN, URGENCY), and outputting compact wire-format messages.

Dataset includes:
- 21 semantic anchor types (RequestTask, InformComplete, EvalApprove, etc.)
- 8% fallback/negative examples (teaching when NOT to quantize)
- Full THOUGHT + QUANTIZE + SLIP supervision
- ShareGPT format (compatible with Unsloth, Axolotl, LLaMA-Factory)

Part of the slipcore reference implementation for the Linux Foundation AAIF ecosystem.
notes: Format: JSONL (ShareGPT). 2,283 training examples. Compatible with Unsloth, Axolotl, LLaMA-Factory, and other LLM finetuning frameworks.
